chapter.title: Networking
chapter.para: The Network settings window helps you control your network card and IP address settings. You will see four tabs:

sect1.title: Connections
sect1.para: In the Connections tab you see a list of your network cards that Ubuntu can use. If you want to change your IP address settings then please click on the Properties button and enter the appropriate information in the Interface properties window. There you can choose whether the device will be activate when your system starts. And you can either choose to set the IP address, subnet mask and gateway address manually (you enter it and it will not be changed automatically) or it will be set automatically using the BOOTP or DHCP servers in your local network. Please ask your network administrator whether your network provides DHCP.

At the bottom you can choose from a list of Current network profiles that you can enter. Profiles are useful when you have a portable computer like a notebook and need to connect to different networks (like at home and at work). It can remember your current settings in a profile and have it set automatically by choosing the desired profile from the list.
